module.name: class_of_activity_library
module.keywords: module, class, library, set theory, activity, relationship, structure, process plant

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record:

ul.li: classes of activity, with their whole-part, connection and involvement relationships; and
set theory relationships, such as subset, union and intersection, between these classes.

li.p: the existence of a class of activity;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_structure application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of activity and another that indicates the nature of a whole-part relationship between two individual activities;
A mapping between classes of activity is a class that has relationships between individual activities as members.
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_structure application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of activity and another that indicates the nature of a connection relationship between two individual activities;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_structure application module.

li.p: a mapping between a class of activity and a class that indicates the nature of an involvement in an activity;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_activity_structure application module.

li.p: set theory relationships, such as subset, union and intersection, between classes of activity and between mappings.
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Set_theory application module. The application of the capability to classes of activity or relationships between classes of activity is specified by this part of ISO 10303.
Individual activity is within the scope of the Individual_activity application module.

li.p: membership of a class of activity.
li.note: Membership of a class of activity is within the scope of the Activity_structure_and_classification application module.

uof.name: class_of_activity_library
uof.description: The class_of_activity_library UOF provides the ability to record information about classes of activity, their structure, and set theory relationships between them.
